Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 6th overall pick, by Wisconsin in 1949...
Injured on 4/9/1950 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 5 days...
Earned first career win on 5/4/1953...
Had first career hit on 8/20/1953, off Michael Countryman (DIA)...
Injured on 7/31/1954 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 4/5/1955 with a Torn Tricep Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Was selected to the 1956 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/23/1958 with a Torn Bicep Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 10/1/1958, going 2-1, 1.25...
Signed as a free agent by Longport on 2/3/1963 to a 3-year deal worth $2,500,000 per year...
Injured on 5/30/1963 with a Bone Chips Elbow, out for 4 weeks...
Released by Longport on 10/5/1965...
Drafted in 5th round, 104th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1967...
Had first career hit on 10/2/1972, off George Venegas (SHP)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/5/1975, off Thomas Smith (DIA)...
Traded from New Jersey to Pittsburgh on 2/6/1976 (Going to PIT: C G. Cardenas, P J. Aiken. Going to NJ: RF J. Hand)...
Signed as a free agent by Columbus on 2/9/1978 to a 3-year deal worth $2,355,555 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Boston (UBA) on 2/14/1981 to a 3-year deal worth $1,010,000 per year...
